div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2333 Cheste, 25 km. W of Valencia, 1864 (238) Burial: c. 200 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 48 AR. Pot hoard with jewelry and silver ingots Hispano-Punic: 4 didr., 1 dr. (as Robin- son 2) 6 didr. (as R. 3) 3 didr. (as R. 7a) 9 didr., 2 dr. (as R. 7c-g) Emporiae: 3 dr. Iberian: 5 dr. (4 Emporitan type, 1 Sa- guntum) Massalia: 2 fr. Roman Rep.: 1 den. Disposition: dispersed Delgado, MAE III, p. 204 â€ Zobel y Zangroniz, MNE 1877-9, pp. 162-9 Amoros, Dracmes, pp. 32-4 Beltran y Villagrasa, Ampurias 1945-6, pp. 301-2 Gomez-Moreno, Miscelaneas, p. 181 de Guadan, Numisma 16 (1955), p. 14; MPER, pp. 80-6 Villaronga, Arse-Saguntum, pp. 86-7; MHC (in press) Raddatz, Schatzfunde, pp. 207-8 Crawford, RRCH 75
